attributes.action: consider seriously not allowing children, unless they have been suitably sedated, or have been taught how to behave in a manner which does not incommode fellow passengers (i.e. properly brought up), from travelling on aeroplanes.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It is impossible to take a flight these days without being subjected to the grotesque caterwauling of an uncontrolled infant. They should not be on the plane. Do their parents have no consideration at all for their fellow passengers? Evidently not. There might be a good case for enforced stupefaction, but surely a more sensible solution would be for the selfish parents to consider the plight of others (otherwise known as altruism) and not take children on board until they knew how to behave. Of course, given the curse of the modern parent, we may never get there.

reasons: Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
